data:
## type alias_AttributeValue
> **AttributeValue** = `string` \| `number` \| `boolean` \| `undefined`


Represents a value that can be assigned to an attribute.

## type alias_ConfigValidator
> **ConfigValidator**\<`T`\> = \{ \[K in keyof T\]: WritableWithDefaultOptions\<T\[K\]\> \| undefined \}


Represents a type that validates a configuration object.

### Type Parameters

#### T

`T` *extends* `object`

The type of the configuration object to be validated.

This type maps each key of the configuration object `T` to an optional
`WritableWithDefaultOptions` type, allowing for partial validation.

## type alias_Directive
> **Directive**\<`T`, `U`\> = (`node`, `args`) => `void` \| \{ `destroy?`: () => `void`; `update?`: (`args`) => `void`; \}


Represents a directive function that can be applied to an SSRHTMLElement.

### Type Parameters

#### T

`T` = `void`

The type of the arguments passed to the directive.

#### U

`U` *extends* [`SSRHTMLElement`](#ssrhtmlelement) = [`SSRHTMLElement`](#ssrhtmlelement)

The type of the SSRHTMLElement, defaults to SSRHTMLElement.

### Parameters

#### node

`U`

The SSRHTMLElement to which the directive is applied.

#### args

`T`

The arguments passed to the directive.

### Returns

`void` \| \{ `destroy?`: () => `void`; `update?`: (`args`) => `void`; \}

An optional object that may contain:
- `update`: A function to update the directive with new arguments.
- `destroy`: A function to clean up when the directive is no longer needed.

## type alias_DirectiveAndParam
> **DirectiveAndParam**\<`T`, `U`\> = \[[`Directive`](#directive)\<`T`, `U`\>, `T`\]


Represents a tuple containing a directive and its associated parameter.

### Type Parameters

#### T

`T`

The type of the parameter associated with the directive.

#### U

`U` *extends* [`SSRHTMLElement`](#ssrhtmlelement) = [`SSRHTMLElement`](#ssrhtmlelement)

The type of the SSRHTMLElement, defaults to SSRHTMLElement.

## type alias_DirectivesAndOptParam
> **DirectivesAndOptParam**\<`T`, `U`\> = \{ \[K in keyof T\]: Directive\<void, U\> \| DirectiveAndParam\<T\[K\], U\> \}


Represents a mapping of directives and their optional parameters.

### Type Parameters

#### T

`T` *extends* `any`[]

An array type representing the parameters for the directives.

#### U

`U` *extends* [`SSRHTMLElement`](#ssrhtmlelement) = [`SSRHTMLElement`](#ssrhtmlelement)

The type of the SSR HTML element, defaults to `SSRHTMLElement`.

## type alias_Extends
> **Extends**\<`T`, `U`\> = `T` *extends* `U` ? `1` : `0`


A conditional type that checks if type `T` extends type `U`.

### Type Parameters

#### T

`T`

The type to check.

#### U

`U`

The type to check against.

### Returns

`1` if `T` extends `U`, otherwise `0`.

## constant_FACTORY_WIDGET_NAME
> `const` **FACTORY\_WIDGET\_NAME**: unique `symbol`


A unique symbol representing a widget factory widget name.

## constant_INVALID_VALUE
> `const` **INVALID\_VALUE**: unique `symbol`


A unique symbol representing an invalid value.
This can be used as a sentinel value to indicate that a variable or property
does not hold a valid value.

## type alias_IsSlotContent
> **IsSlotContent**\<`T`\> = [`Extends`](#extends)\<`T`, `SlotContent`\<`any`\>\> \| [`Extends`](#extends)\<`SlotContent`\<`any`\>, `T`\> *extends* `1` ? `T` : `0`


Type utility to determine if a given type `T` is or extends `SlotContent<any>`.

This utility uses conditional types to check if `T` extends `SlotContent<any>` or if `SlotContent<any>` extends `T`.
If either condition is true, it returns `T`, otherwise it returns `0`.

### Type Parameters

#### T

`T`

The type to be checked.

### Returns

`T` if `T` is or extends `SlotContent<any>`, otherwise `0`.

## type alias_NormalizeValue
> **NormalizeValue**\<`T`\> = (`value`) => `T` \| *typeof* [`INVALID_VALUE`](#invalid_value)


A type alias for a function that normalizes a value of type `T`.
The function takes a value of type `T` and returns either a normalized value of type `T`
or a special constant `INVALID_VALUE` indicating that the value is invalid.

### Type Parameters

#### T

`T`

The type of the value to be normalized.

### Parameters

#### value

`T`

The value to be normalized.

### Returns

`T` \| *typeof* [`INVALID_VALUE`](#invalid_value)

The normalized value of type `T` or `INVALID_VALUE` if the value is invalid.

## interface_PropsConfig

Interface representing the configuration for properties.

### Type Parameters

#### U

`U` *extends* `object`

An object type representing the properties.

### Properties

#### config?

> `optional` **config**: [`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<[`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`U`\>\> \| [`ValuesOrReadableSignals`](#valuesorreadablesignals)\<[`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`U`\>\>


Either a store of objects containing, for each property, the default value,
or an object containing, for each property, either a store containing the default value or the default value itself.

***

#### props?

> `optional` **props**: [`ValuesOrWritableSignals`](#valuesorwritablesignals)\<`U`\>


Object containing, for each property, either its initial value, or a store that will contain the value at any time.
When the value of a property is undefined or invalid, the value from the config is used.

## type alias_SlotContent
> **SlotContent**\<`Props`\> = `string` \| `Snippet`\<\[`Props`\]\>


Represents the content of a slot, which can either be a `string` or a `Snippet`.

### Type Parameters

#### Props

`Props` *extends* `object` = `object`

The type of the properties that the Snippet can accept.

### See

[https://svelte.dev/docs/svelte/snippet](https://svelte.dev/docs/svelte/snippet)

## interface_SSRHTMLElement

Represents a server-side rendered HTML element with limited functionality.

This interface extends a subset of the [HTMLElement](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement) interface, providing
methods to set and remove attributes, manipulate the element's classes, and
partially manipulate the element's style.

It inherits the [setAttribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Element/setAttribute) and [getAttribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Element/getAttribute) methods from the [HTMLElement](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement) interface.

### Properties

#### classList

> **classList**: [`Pick`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#picktype-keys)\<[`HTMLElement`](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement)\[`"classList"`\], `"add"` \| `"remove"` \| `"toggle"`\>


Object allowing to manipulate the classes of the element.

***

#### style

> **style**: [`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<[`Record`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#recordkeys-type)\<[`StyleKey`](#stylekey), [`StyleValue`](#stylevalue)\>\>


Object allowing to manipulate the style of the element.

## type alias_StyleKey
> **StyleKey** = [`Exclude`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#excludeuniontype-excludedmembers)\<keyof [`CSSStyleDeclaration`](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/CSSStyleDeclaration), `"length"` \| `"item"` \| `"parentRule"` \| `"getPropertyValue"` \| `"getPropertyPriority"` \| `"setProperty"` \| `"removeProperty"` \| *typeof* [`Symbol.iterator`](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Symbol/iterator) \| `number` \| `"cssText"`\>


Represents a key of the CSSStyleDeclaration interface, excluding certain properties and methods.

This is useful for scenarios where you need to work with CSS properties directly without
dealing with the methods and other non-style properties of CSSStyleDeclaration.

## type alias_StyleValue
> **StyleValue** = `string` \| `undefined` \| `null`


Represents a value that can be used for styling purposes.

### Remarks

This type can be a string representing a style value, or it can be undefined or null.
It is useful for scenarios where a style value might be optional or not set.

## type alias_ValuesOrReadableSignals
> **ValuesOrReadableSignals**\<`T`\> = \{ \[K in keyof T\]?: ReadableSignal\<T\[K\] \| undefined\> \| T\[K\] \}


A type that maps each property of an object type `T` to either a `ReadableSignal` of that property type or the property type itself.

### Type Parameters

#### T

`T` *extends* `object`

The object type whose properties are being mapped.

## type alias_ValuesOrWritableSignals
> **ValuesOrWritableSignals**\<`T`\> = \{ \[K in keyof T\]?: WritableSignal\<T\[K\] \| undefined\> \| T\[K\] \}


A type that maps the properties of an object type `T` to either a `WritableSignal` of the property type or the property type itself.

### Type Parameters

#### T

`T` *extends* `object`

The object type whose properties are being mapped.

## interface_Widget

Represents a generic widget with reactive state, stores, and various functionalities.

### Template

The type of the action handlers for user interactions.

### Type Parameters

#### Props

`Props` *extends* `object` = `object`

The type of the properties that can be passed to the widget.

#### State

`State` *extends* `object` = `object`

The type of the state managed by the widget.

#### Api

`Api` *extends* `object` = `object`

The type of the API functions available for interacting with the widget.

#### Directives

`Directives` *extends* `object` = `object`

The type of the directives used in the widget's template.

### Properties

#### api

> **api**: `Api`


all the api functions to interact with the widget

***

#### directives

> **directives**: `Directives`


directives to be used on html elements in the template of the widget or in the slots

***

#### state$

> **state$**: [`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<`State`\>


the reactive state of the widget, combining all the values served by the stores

***

#### stores

> **stores**: \{ \[K in string \| number \| symbol as \`$\{K & string\}$\`\]: ReadableSignal\<State\[K\]\> \}


the different stores of the widget, all reactive

### Methods

#### patch

> **patch**(`parameters`): `void`


Modify the parameter values, and recalculate the stores accordingly

##### Parameters

###### parameters

[`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`Props`\>

##### Returns

`void`

## type alias_WidgetFactory
> **WidgetFactory**\<`W`, `T`\> = `T` & `object`


A factory function type for creating instances of a widget.

### Type Declaration

#### \[FACTORY\_WIDGET_NAME\]?

> `optional` **\[FACTORY\_WIDGET\_NAME\]**: `string`

### Type Parameters

#### W

`W` *extends* [`Widget`](#widget)

The type of the widget that extends the base Widget type.

#### T

`T` *extends* (`props?`) => `W` = (`props?`) => `W`

The type of the factory function that creates the widget. Useful when the factory function has a generic

### Param

Optional configuration properties for the widget.

### Returns

An instance of the widget.

## type alias_WidgetProps
> **WidgetProps**\<`T`\> = `T` *extends* `object` ? `U` : `never`


Extracts the type of the argument expected by the `patch` method of a given type `T`.

This utility type takes a generic type `T` which must have a `patch` method. The `patch` method
should accept an argument that is a partial of some object type `U`. If `T` meets this condition,
`WidgetProps` will resolve to the type `U`. Otherwise, it will resolve to `never`.

### Type Parameters

#### T

`T` *extends* `object`

A type that includes a `patch` method accepting a partial object.

## interface_WidgetSlotContext

Represents the context for a widget slot, providing access to the widget and its state.

### Type Parameters

#### W

`W` *extends* [`Widget`](#widget)

The type of the widget.

### Properties

#### api

> **api**: `W`\[`"api"`\]


all the api functions to interact with the widget

***

#### directives

> **directives**: `W`\[`"directives"`\]


directives to be used on html elements in the template of the widget or in the slots

***

#### state

> **state**: [`WidgetState`](#widgetstate)\<`W`\>


the state of the widget

## type alias_WidgetState
> **WidgetState**\<`T`\> = `T` *extends* `object` ? `U` : `never`


Extracts the state type from a widget type that contains a `state$` property.

### Type Parameters

#### T

`T` *extends* `object`

A type that extends an object with a `state$` property of type `SubscribableStore<any>`.

### Returns

The type of the state contained within the `state$` property if it extends an object, otherwise `never`.

## interface_WritableWithDefaultOptions

Interface representing options for a writable store with default values.

### Type Parameters

#### T

`T`

The type of the value stored.

### Properties

#### equal()?

> `optional` **equal**: (`a`, `b`) => `boolean`


the equal function, allowing to compare two values. used to check if a previous and current values are equals.

##### Parameters

###### a

`T`

###### b

`T`

##### Returns

`boolean`

***

#### normalizeValue?

> `optional` **normalizeValue**: [`NormalizeValue`](#normalizevalue)\<`T`\>


the normalize value function. should return the [INVALID\_VALUE](#invalid_value) symbol when the provided value is invalid
